required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Somatostatin Receptor Imaging in Patients With Suspected Cardiac Sarcoidosis
clinical_study.official_title: Somatostatin Receptor Imaging in Patients With Suspected Cardiac Sarcoidosis

lead_sponsor.agency: Marcelo F. Di Carli, MD, FACC

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this research study to find out if a drug called OctreoScan or DOTATATE can help doctors diagnose people with cardiac sarcoidosis better.
OctreoScan and DOTATATE are both approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) to diagnose certain tumors.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Characterized by Abnormal or Negative Uptake
primary_outcome.description: To correlate localization and number of increased radiotracer foci between FDG-PET and DOTATATE studies.

secondary_outcome.description: To correlate localization and number of increased radiotracer foci between FDG-PET and DOTATATE studies.

arm_group.description: Patients with biopsy-proven extra-cardiac sarcoidosis OR atypical findings on FDG PET and MRI without previous biopsy will be recruited to receive an injection of the FDA-approved radiotracer Indium-111 Pentreotide (OctreoScan). The imaging protocol will consist of imaging at 4 and 24 hours after OctreoScan injection.

Patients with biopsy-proven extra-cardiac sarcoidosis OR atypical findings on FDG PET and MRI without previous biopsy will be recruited to receive an injection of the FDA-approved radiotracer Gallium-68 DOTATATE. The imaging protocol will consist of imaging 1 hour after injection for DOTATATE.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Individuals aged 18 or older
- Documentation of biopsy-proven sarcoidosis OR patients with typical findings on FDG PET and MRI without previous biopsy
- Clinical suspicion of cardiac involvement defined as the presence of any of the following: high-degree A-V nodal block, complete bundle branch block, reduced left or right ventricular systolic function, any cardiac arrhythmia, and/or unexplained chest pain, dyspnea or syncope
- PET/CT imaging demonstrating abnormal myocardial FDG uptake consistent with active inflammatory myocardium.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Initiation of steroids or any other immunosuppressive medication(s) following the completion of FDG-PET, as these medications, in theory, may subsequently suppress OctreoScan or DOTATATE uptake in the heart.
- Patients with history of neuroendocrine tumors (specially insulinomas)
- Patients taking the medication Octreotide
- Patients on total parenteral nutrition (TPN)
- Women who are pregnant or breastfeeding

responsible_party.investigator_full_name: Marcelo F. Di Carli, MD, FACC

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Indium-111 Pentreotide (OctreoScan)
group.description: Patients with biopsy-proven extra-cardiac sarcoidosis OR atypical findings on FDG PET and MRI without previous biopsy will be recruited to receive an injection of the FDA-approved radiotracer Indium-111 Pentreotide (OctreoScan). The imaging protocol will consist of imaging at 4 and 24 hours after OctreoScan injection.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Number of Participants Characterized by Abnormal or Negative Uptake
outcome.description: To correlate localization and number of increased radiotracer foci between FDG-PET and DOTATATE studies.
outcome.population: We initially planned to do OctreoScan, but Dotatate became FDA approved in the process. Due to the superior image quality, lower radiation, and shorter protocol for Dotatate, we decided to abandon OctreoScan.

group.title: Gallium-68 DOTATATE
group.description: Patients with biopsy-proven extra-cardiac sarcoidosis OR atypical findings on FDG PET and MRI without previous biopsy will be recruited to receive an injection of the FDA-approved radiotracer Gallium-68 DOTATATE. The imaging protocol will consist of imaging at 1 hour after injection for DOTATATE.

group.title: Indium-111 Pentreotide (OctreoScan)
group.description: Patients with biopsy-proven extra-cardiac sarcoidosis OR atypical findings on FDG PET and MRI without previous biopsy will be recruited to receive an injection of the FDA-approved radiotracer Indium-111 Pentreotide (OctreoScan). The imaging protocol will consist of imaging at 4 and 24 hours after OctreoScan injection.

measure.title: Number of Participants Characterized by Abnormal or Negative Uptake
measure.description: To correlate localization and number of increased radiotracer foci between FDG-PET and DOTATATE studies.
measure.population: We initially planned to do OctreoScan, but Dotatate became FDA approved in the process. Due to the superior image quality, lower radiation, and shorter protocol for Dotatate, we decided to abandon OctreoScan.

outcome.title: Effect of Treatment
outcome.description: To correlate localization and number of increased radiotracer foci between FDG-PET and DOTATATE studies.
outcome.population: Only one patient underwent a repeat Dotatate PET/CT scan to investigate treatment response in our study

group.title: Participants With a Positive or Negative Response to Treatment
group.description: Patients with biopsy-proven extra-cardiac sarcoidosis OR atypical findings on FDG PET and MRI without previous biopsy will be recruited to receive an injection of the FDA-approved radiotracer Indium-111 Pentreotide (OctreoScan) or Gallium-68 DOTATATE. The imaging protocol will consist of imaging at 1 hour after injection for DOTATATE.

measure.title: Effect of Treatment
measure.description: To correlate localization and number of increased radiotracer foci between FDG-PET and DOTATATE studies.
measure.population: Only one patient underwent a repeat Dotatate PET/CT scan to investigate treatment response in our study

category.title: Number of Subjects wPositive Response to Treatment
Number of Subjects wNegative Response to Treatment

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected until up to 4 days after the last visit. One subject completed the optional Study Day 2 visit, so adverse events were collected up to 6 months after consent.

group.title: Indium-111 Pentreotide (OctreoScan)
group.description: Patients with biopsy-proven extra-cardiac sarcoidosis OR atypical findings on FDG PET and MRI without previous biopsy will be recruited to receive an injection of the FDA-approved radiotracer Indium-111 Pentreotide (OctreoScan). The imaging protocol will consist of imaging at 4 and 24 hours after OctreoScan injection.

group.title: Gallium-68 DOTATATE
group.description: Patients with biopsy-proven extra-cardiac sarcoidosis OR atypical findings on FDG PET and MRI without previous biopsy will be recruited to receive an injection of the FDA-approved radiotracer or Gallium-68 DOTATATE. The imaging protocol will consist of imaging at 1 hour after injection for DOTATATE.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Limitations include small sample size (we only included individuals with myocardial FDG uptake) and there is no gold standard for the diagnosis of inflammation.
